topics.body:
Goddamnit Pearl, I know you were playing in the Winding Way. Not my fault I'm an eighth of an inch away from _exactly_ where you were playing.

topics.body:
"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55ad2147636872022900128f#post_55ad2147636872022900128f
The creepy faces in LA Noire was more of an effect caused by having motion-capture. Really damn good motion-capture, mind you, but it still made some faces look off. Then again, maybe they should've looked more cartoony. But I still have to give credit to the motion-capture, 'cos you can tell a lot of effort was put into it.

topics.body:
"@ice1517":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55ad229163687247a8000cea#post_55ad229163687247a8000cea
Sounds funny to me.

"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55ad229363687247a8000ced#post_55ad229363687247a8000ced
Yeah, he really, really does. Though I guess LA Noire is a little bit of a trial-and-error game, because if you remove the hint system and once you're past the tutorial, it actually is kinda hard. Hell, in the first non-tutorial interrogation, I failed 5 times because I either chose the wrong response or presented the wrong evidence.
